results.title: Rancho Notorious
results.creator_credit: Howard Welsch, Fidelity Pictures and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: A Story of hate, murder and revenge, this is Fritz Lang’s classic Western starring the great Marlene Dietrich in a typically sexy role. Vern Haskell (Arthur Kennedy) and his fiancee Beth (Gloria Henry) are to be married in 8 days time. One afternoon when Beth is minding her father’s store, two strangers ride into town. One of the men enters the store and tells her to open the safe, but it soon becomes obvious that he wants more than the money. From across the street a boy hears a gun shot ring out, and then sees a man make his escape. Vern is called and pushes through the crowd to find Beth dead. The stage is set for one of the great revenge western. In pursuit of Beth’s assaillant, Vern finds his way to Chuk-a-luck ranch, a safe haven for runaway outlaws run with an iron fist by Altar Keane (Marlene Dietrich) and her boyfriend Frenchy Fairmont (Mel Ferrer). Adpated to the screen by Daniel Taradash and Silvia Richards from her novel “Gunsight Whitman”.

results.title: Ranchero and gauchos in Argentina
results.brief_description: Describes life on a cattle ranch near Buenos Aires. Shows gauchos working with the herd and the use of scientific farming methods. Contrasts the lives of the wealthy rancher and his employees. No other credits available.

results.title: Ranch house blues
results.creator_credit: E Derr, Rodeo Comedies, Pathé Frères and Robert De Lacey
results.brief_description: A Western comedy with musical interludes. Cast includes Don Douglass, Mildred Harris, Harry Woods, Nick Cogley, Billy Burt, Tom Mahoney and the Empire Comedy Four. Script, Robert De Lacey and Hugh Cummings. Photography, Edward Snyder. Music, Josiah Zuro. Editing, Joseph Kane.

results.title: Rana
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
The story of a young Muslim girl student living in a crowded section of Old Delhi. The customary veiling of women (Purdah) and impending marriage by arrangement are examined.

results.title: Ran
results.creator_credit: Serge Silberman, Masato Haro and Akira Kurosawa
results.brief_description: Set in 16th century Japan, an ageing ruler, Lord Hidetora attempts to peacefully divide his hard-won Kingdom among his three sons. Then ruthless ambition, evil plots woven by scheming advisers, and Hidetora’s own past savagery combine to spawn a whirlwind of chaos. It drives the old man insane, shatters his Kingdom and destroys his family. A visually extraordinary weaving of plot strands from “King Lear” with a Japanese folk legend. “Ran” translates as “Chaos”.

results.title: Ramp Riot 111
results.brief_description: Watch the rad action of the world’s best skaters in “Ramp Riot 111” held at Festival Hall, Melbourne, in November 1989. Chris Miller, Jeff Phillips and Bod Boyle from the USA, battle the top Aussie skaters, Gary Valentine, Adam Luxford, Jason Ellis, Tony Hallam and Lee Ralph. This program highlights the unreal action from this event, including footage never seen before which was actually shot from inside the ramp.

results.title: Rambo: first blood. Part II (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Buzz Feitshans, Tri-Star Pictures and George Pan Cosmatos
results.brief_description: He’s on a mission and that’s just where he belongs! He’s told not to engage the enemy. “Just take pictures”, they say. But telling Rambo to hold back is like ordering a rattle-snake not to bite. Rambo’s dropped into the Vietnam jungle to find out if there are still any POW’s about. There are. And now Rambo’s going to get them home - on his own! Caption version only available. Rated: M

results.title: Rambo: first blood. Part II
results.creator_credit: Buzz Feitshans, Tri-Star Pictures and George Pan Cosmatos
results.brief_description: Rambo is sent on a secret mission to help the U.S. Government find remaining Prisoners of War in Vietnam. However, although the mission is designed to fail, the bureaucrats did not take into account Rambo’s fierce determination, courage and skill to bring them back - alone if necessary. Rambo is launched into the jungle and the film explodes into one fireball action sequence after another.

results.title: Rambo Issues 1985
results.brief_description: A current affairs style program, with panel members - including Phillip Adams and Max Teichman - discussing the political and moral implications of the film “Rambo”. Excerpts from Rambo are discussed alongside recorded interviews with a Vietnam veteran and a representative from a South American refugee organisation.

results.title: Rambo III (Captioned)
results.brief_description: John Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) finds himself caught in the war torn Middle East, after his longtime friend, Colonel Trautmen falls into Russian hands. The Soviets, equipped with state-of-the-art weapons, horrifying hi-tech helicopters, tanks and an army of highly trained men, are capable of annihilating any opposition they encounter. However, Rambo is no ordinary soldier, he’s a one-man army who will face the Russians head-on in the most awesome confrontation of his life.
